subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Confirmation Bias: Hearing Only What You Want
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Confirmation Bias: Hearing Only What You Want.

hook.text: Kodak invented the digital camera in 1975. Then they buried itâ€”it contradicted their film business model.

buildup.text: Confirmation bias is seeking information that supports what you already believe and ignoring the rest.

discovery.text: Founders are especially vulnerable. They're emotionally invested in their vision being correct.

twist.text: Customer interviews become confirmation traps. People tell founders what they want to hear.

climax.text: BlackBerry's CEO saw the iPhone and said 'not a serious threat.' He only listened to those who agreed.

punchline.text: The most dangerous lies are the ones you tell yourself.

quiz.question: How does confirmation bias typically affect founders?
options: They seek evidence supporting their idea and dismiss contradicting signals
They confirm every decision with their board of directors
They rely too heavily on competitor analysis
